alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 10 at 1:43PM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE IN THE HIGH COUNTRY FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY... .A storm system is expected to bring heavy snow to the north central mountains of Colorado starting late this morning and continue through Saturday afternoon, heaviest tonight. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur in the Park and Gore Ranges, the I-70 corridor will also be affected but with lesser amounts. The combination of heavy snow and gusty winds will cause poor visibility and difficult travel conditions. Weekend mountain travel will be impacted with icy and snowpacked roads. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...North Park, and Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet
